text: heya <@UEW3R63D1>, if you use "Actions" > "Clone to HTML" for your drag and drop templates, those files will all show up in FTP, and can be backed up.

Heya <@UFK3FG541>, this is actually a feature of older custom modules, and something we removed for new custom modules. It caused more issues (read: someone adding 500px of padding, then wondering why something wasn't responsive) than it solved. And, with new fields (color, number, etc) the functionality can be added into the custom module itself.
Heya <@U3A4KEWK1>! I've seen one other instance of this, but ultimately, couldn't reproduce it/find any errors. If they call into support, someone could definitely poke around on a screenshare.
They said they did talk to support, and support just said to "talk with whoever manages my network"
Am I able to see how many/what pages use a certain template?
Right click on the template and select "show dependents"
Thank you so much!

I feel like I’m missing something obvious, but is there a reason the DM gives warnings for using ```{{ content.absolute_url }}``` even though that’s what the documentation shows? In general I get a bunch of warning around using content tokens, even though they render just fine.
It’s a known issue. We’re working on fixing it.
But it’s harmless.

Is there anything special we have to do to be able to get HubSpot Videos to appear in a rich text module in a custom module? I have the rich text module name inserted just like any other one, but the video doesn’t appear on the page and in the code it’s as if the rich text module doesn’t exist.
you may need to enabel the vidyard integration but other than that no. you just add the video through the rich text module’s video button and it just works

Yeah I did enable the integration. I have the ability to insert it into the Rich Text Module. But on the actual page it doesn’t display. I’m assuming it’s because it’s part of a custom module. But I know I have the variable name inserted properly. So wondered if there was something else I was missing <@U7SL518D6>. I’ll keep playing around with it.
when you inspect the page where that HubL code is that the video uses, do you see any html there at all
if you do see HTML then I’d check your console for a javascript error, it may be that the code that renders it, is erroring or being prevented from rendering because of another error unrelated to it

Nope, it’s a blank Div. When I look in the Rich Text module in the Editor it appears like this though: {% video_player “embed_player” overrideable=False, type=‘scriptV4’, hide_playlist=True, viral_sharing=False, embed_button=False, width=‘1280’, height=‘720’, player_id=‘7228301236’, style=‘’ %}

So I’m wondering if the {% video_player %} is causing issues because then that would be wrapped by the {{ variable_name }} of the rich text module that’s in the div in the custom module?? hahaha.
Wish we just had some type of Video Module we could insert for the new HubSpot Videos. :slightly_smiling_face:
it should work as is. like I said check for a javascript error

Something is definitely wonky here.

- If I put in just text in the rich text module, it renders on the page properly.
- If I click the video icon in the rich text box and pick a video from File Manager, it does not render (the video or the rich text box) on the page.
- If I put text in the field AND insert the video, it renders properly on the page.
- If I remove the text and keep the video, it renders properly.

Seems like for some reason it needs text or something else in the rich text module with the video first in order to render but then the text can be removed?? No console errors either.
weird

Any way to increase code window text size? Currently, I can zoom in using chrome browser zoom, but then the module fields section gets giant and covers code. I am looking for a non hack way to do this if possible. Thank you.

There is a way of customizing it coming down the pipeline. you’ll have to be patient.

If that feature weren’t already in the works by HS I’d have added it to the :chrome: <#CBBAW6Z3R|community-browser-extension>
Curious how patient?
I think i heard somewhere between a few weeks to a couple months
Nice. Thanks.
There is currently a beta which that is apart of
